intro: Alismorkis brevicornu, commonly known as the narrow-fruited water plantain, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland environments in eastern Asia. It typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant has narrow, ribbon-like leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, and it produces small, white or greenish flowers in the summer. Its rhizomatous root system helps it spread and colonize new areas within its habitat. Alismorkis brevicornu plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and amphibians.
